abstract: Lear, the auto parts maker, has delayed a shareholder vote on a $2.9 billion buyout offer from Carl Icahn. The vote was rescheduled to July 12 from June 27 in response to criticism of the bid from shareholders and proxy advisory services. Mr. Icahn made the bid, valued at $36 a share, through his American Real Estate Partners.
lead_paragraph: Lear, the auto parts maker, has delayed a shareholder vote on a $2.9 billion buyout offer from Carl Icahn. The vote was rescheduled to July 12 from June 27 in response to criticism of the bid from shareholders and proxy advisory services. Mr. Icahn made the bid, valued at $36 a share, through his American Real Estate Partners.

headline.main: Lear Delays Vote on Icahn Deal
